_meanings:
{@--6@} (In <ab>phil.</ab>). ‘That
unseen virtue which is a relation
superinduced, not before 
possessed, unseen but efficacious to 
connect the consequence with its
past and remote cause and to
bring about at a distant period or
in another world the relative effect’
Colebrooke.

{@--1@} The remote 
consequence of an act (as the acquisition
of heaven which is the result of
good deeds).

{@--2@} Virtue and vice
({#pApapuRyaM#}) as the eventual cause of
future happiness or misery.

religious rites the power
of which on the future is not
seen before.

one who
has had no husband before, a 
virgin; {#°tiH kumArI#} <ls>Sk.</ls>

discussion or talk about the Supreme
Soul.

an authoritative 
direction or injunction which is
quite new; it is of four kinds  
{#karmaviDi, guRaviDi, viniyogaviDi#} and {#prayogaviDi#}.
